Review Title: It’s a good hotel but not nessarary worth the money
Negative Reviews:
1) The pool area is small and has limited business hours , not to mention that the hotel charges for a bed around the pool, and they only have something like 10 beds. It’s 10  Euro for a bed for 4 hours. Either 10:00 to 14:00 or 14:00 to 19;00. This was very unexpected !!!!
To get a bed you need to reserve in  advance at least the day before or stay in the queue in the entrance , at least 15 mins before it opens!


2) The blue line of the metro is 10 mins walking distance from the hotel but in summer time  even in early June , 10 mins are like 30 mins,,,, You need to keep in mind the blue line does not get to the Olyimpic stadium and u need to switch to the green line if u plan to get to the olyimpic stadium for a show.  


3) it’s pretty far from the main squares by foot ;
Positive Reviews:
Breakfast was ok ( eggs,  only tomatoes and cucumbers , a few types of bread and cheese, etc. don’t expect good capochino ); note-  they don’t have too many options for vegan people 

The hotel is clean
Pretty big rooms considering it is in the city .  

A few bus lines run from the hotel to the city and to the stadium. Keep in mind most of them do not turn on air conditioning even in the summer time …

The staff in the hotel is  nice and polite and agreed to allow late check out with no extra charge . 

There are a few good restaurants around the hotel. One just across the street  The name is Spitiko Fagito, home style dishes , very good food and cheap. The are open  Mon~Fri from noon to 17;00 . Pay attention to the design and decoration inside . Added some photos ….
Another really good restaurant , but more expensive,  is a 1 min from the Anafiotika metro station . It’s calls Joann’s restaurant. Check the reviews in  trip advisors and you won’t be disappointed! The dishes are big , and can be shared. Very good verity of options, including for veggies .


There is also a big supermarket 5 mins away from the hotel 

When we stayed there before the Codeplay show, the hotel was fully booked and yet you didn’t feel it was too crowded . They were very organized to the fact that lots of people come to the concert

The only other negative was the amount of times I had to keep ringing room service to bring me some milk portions for my cuppa.  not enough portions left in the rooms. Below the standard you would expect in a 4 star hotel, and poor value for money. Without the rooftop pool it's hard to see why you would want to pay the fairly steep price to stay here, especially when you add on the 17 Euro per day parking costs, so check that the pool is open before booking.

Review Title: Reasonable prices, good location, friendly staff and a lovely roof garden. WiFi not good enough
Negative Reviews:
Over three stays in the past 2-3 years, the one thing that does NOT work at the hotel is the free WiFi. You should not try to work on it, most times of the day it is not good even for casual web browsing, much less videoconferencing or Netflix. Make sure you have roaming (and can hotspot your phone if you really need to get something done on your laptop). Pro tip: When roaming chose the Cosmote over the Vodafone mobile network, the latter is very spotty here.
 
We also could not just put the parking costs on our bill, in our case due to a "temporary problem" you had to pay for the parking on each exit, separately, via the automatic teller. A minor annoyance.
Positive Reviews: The reception, staff, and location are all excellent. The roof garden / pool bar is a lovely place for dinner or just a coffee. The upper floors are wonderfully renovated, and their amenities and very diligent cleaning and turn-down service are just right for an international traveler. Proximity to the city center and the nearby metro station help the visitor get around without getting stuck in the very center of the city.

Review Title: The extra charges they are trying to make is a concern
Negative Reviews: See above
Positive Reviews:
President is one of my favourite hotels in Europe, and I travel a lot. The staff are generally fantastic, helpful and some remember me from previous stays. 

What irks me is that instead of one consolidated price when you book, they are looking for add ons. This year they want you to pay 10 to 20 euros for a deck chair! Outrageous! 

I met some people who take almond in their coffee. The hotel doesn’t have almond milk so I watched the lady be hassled twice for drinking coffee from an outside supplier. Her group of 14 was staying 8 days, so you would think it would be ok, logic went out the window 

I was swimming one morning and I had ordered some food. The food is overpriced and sometimes bland but as I like to eat at the pool bar, I can tolerate it. As I was in the water a waitress came to ask me if I could pay. Seriously! Let the customer swim and gently ask later on for payment especially when they have been paying for stuff and staying at the hotel. 

Wifi drops out a lot. It reminds of the years when you had to pay for wifi here. Joke not 

To cut some more corners, this four star hotel now has the very cheap shampoo, replacing the little bottles with fixed larger bottles that are wedged into the bathroom and sink. It’s really average stuff 

The safe of course didn’t work. Happens often

My stay here for once included what I paid for, an actual double bed instead of the two singles joined together 

I have fond memories of this place and it’s well staffed, except for the 70 minutes you can wait for food. Therefore it pains me to give them an average review but they need to be smart about how they make their extras without antagonising customers.
Management need to read this and reassess what they are doing

Review Title: Exceptional reception, plush beds, rooftop views and bustling breakfasts
Negative Reviews: We had some noisy neighbors and you could sometimes hear conversations of people walking down the hall, but earplugs can fix that. Note that whether you booked a 1 night or 5 night stay, you only get two complimentary waters in the fridge. You can purchase water at the lobby, though it's cheaper to walk 5-10 min down the road and get a big bottle from one of those pop-up stands if you're staying a while. The metro station isn't too far of a walk away, but the sidewalks won't be easy to traverse if you have some big heavy bags.
Positive Reviews: The beds were very comfortable and the shampoos provided were very pleasant. The in-room small fridge was helpful and we were able to get a view of the Acropolis from our room! This hotel was a bit further from the conference centre (travelled for work), but the 25min walk was worth it to have the rooftop pool access and the rooftop restaurant views. The breakfast buffet was optional for a fee, but a great deal if you're looking for variety and a nice cappuccino machine (local cafes are nice for coffee and some baking but are not cheap). Note that this hotel seems to be used a lot for big groups so you may want to make a reservation for breakfast if you don't want to wait for a free table during the busy 8-9:30am rush. We travelled from Athens to the greek islands then returned to President Hotel for a night before flying home and really appreciated that they offered free luggage storage for the whole week we were away!!! I highly recommend only using the ferry system with a carry-on sized bag.

Please do yourself a favour and don’t stay here! 
From the moment we arrived at the hotel we didn’t feel welcome. We walked up to the reception to check in and the receptionist blankly stared at me, no welcome how can I help, until I had to say hi I’d like to check in. It was such a strange first experience after coming from Naxos where everyone was so lovely and helpful.

We were told we were not allowed any food or drinks from outside the hotel in the hotel. This is obviously to make the most money out of the guests, despite the fact the food at the hotel is sub par.

This place is so dirty and old.

We went down to reception to complain and say we weren’t happy but I was told that’s the room I booked and if I wanted to change I had to pay.
Why would I want to give this hotel anymore of my money? 

The only nice area is the pool but we we asked for an umbrella for the intense heat from the sun they said no it’s a health and safety issue. 

The area isn’t a good one for Athens, staying in Plaka would have been a lot better. The area was run down and you had to taxi anywhere, no very many good restaurants. The only plus on the area is the great bakery opposite the hotel. 

I would avoid this place at all costs!!! 
I’m sure I will get a reply to this review from a manager trying to pretend it was fine but please don’t stay here, there are so many other better places in Athens.

I stayed here 8 years ago, too. 
The location of the hotel is perfect; just between Panormou and Ampellokipoi metro stations and it takes only afew stops to get to Sytagma and Monastraki.
It is a safe place. 
The hotel is very clean. Compared to my previous stay, it looks much more cleaner as it has ben renewed. Nice. 
The personnel are all very kind and helpful.

Review Title: If you are tempted to book because of the rooftop pool- Don’t!
Negative Reviews:
Really disappointed with the hotel. We booked this hotel as a treat at the end of our holiday because of the pool. However, despite it being advertised as free (including the sun loungers and umbrellas on booking.com) it is not. Upon arrival we were informed there is a 10 euro fee per lounger. So for myself and my two kids that’s 30 euros.  I was reluctant but willing to pay that, but when we got to the pool was informed that it is 30 euros for the morning session (10-2) and another 30 for the afternoon session (2-7). We had afternoon plans so only wanted to use the pool from 12-3 but was told this would be 60 euros. If you buy food or drinks you are allowed to sit at a table under the awning but still have to pay for the sun lounger. There are no other seats or areas to sit. There is a bench that you’re ‘allowed’ to put your towel on. You can’t even just sit on the floor! This is an outrageous way to treat the hotel guests and essentially means the pool is not available unless you pay. This is contrary to what is advertised on booking.com and not at all clear or transparent on the hotel website or at check in. I tried to speak to a manager about the situation as two members of staff had agreed it was unreasonable but told it’s ‘policy’.  However the manager was in a meeting and I was told to come back later. I left my room number but the manager made no effort to speak and resolve the issues.

Additionally, the hotel seems set up for large group bookings where inevitably all the members of the group do the same thing at the same time. This means if you unfortunately arrive for breakfast at the same time it’s chaos- not enough tables, food and the communal areas were at times really crowded and congested.

We also had a cockroach in our bathroom and needed to change rooms. The hotel is also about 30 walk and metro from the centre. The latter issues, we don’t really care about (especially the distance from centre as our plan had been to spend the day at the pool)

Review Title: Really looked forward to this stay but was immensely disappointed
Negative Reviews:
Firstly - so money hungry. I stayed at this hotel as I saw the weather in Athens and wanted somewhere I could just really chill out and reset on my trip. But when the gym set me back €8 each visit and the pool sun beds another €10, a very sour taste was left in my mouth about this concept entirely. Also, while the gym was (slightly) bigger than normal hotel gyms, the equipment and machines were dated and the only good things were the treadmills. 
Secondly - the pool was dirty. I feel as though if you’re even just staying at a hotel, yet alone paying for a sun bed, the pool should be pristine but when I went to swim I could see little pieces of rubbish and tissue floating around. 
Thirdly - the location. While I’m sure fine if you’re willing to fork out on taxis etc, if you want to stay in the heart of Athens look elsewhere. I found myself walking 50 mins daily just to get to the heart of Athens. Yes, there is a train line however not in close proximity to the hotel. 
Finally, as someone incredibly susceptible to mould, I was not happy with the facilities. There was mould in the shower head and some of the bathroom facilities just seemed dated. 
I was really looking forward to this stay, and while I absolutely loved Athens, I will certainly not be staying here again given the price tag and extras … can’t say I have ever had to pay to use hotel facilities before.

I never like to leave bad reviews, however, I feel like it would do the public a disservice to NOT voice my concerns. 

We checked in with one of the receptionists who had a terrible attitude. We asked if there was possibly a room on the upper floor that we could change to and she gave us a look, then responded with "you paid for the cheapest room." Even if English isn't your first language, there is no reason to treat your guests with this level of disdain. 

The next morning, we went to check out the pool, which seemed to be the bread and butter of this hotel's attraction point, and were appalled to find garbage in the water. We then informed the front desk and the lady said "you need to talk to the people upstairs." They are the representative of the hotel and at least they could've said they'll forward the message to their staff. 

Lastly, the room reeked of urine and mold. It was a wholly unpleasant experience and I sincerely hope the hotel management reads this and makes some conscious effort to change their ways. Don't just respond to the positive reviews.
